item.title: Why most product planning is bad and what to do about it
item.description: Product planning can often become overly complicated. The article emphasizes the limitations of OKRs, noting they tend to add more ceremony than clarity. A solution highlighted is Problem Driven Development, a focused 4-day quarterly process. This method prioritizes identifying problems, encourages team collaboration, and promotes public commitment. This approach has enabled the team to maintain productivity as they scaled to over 1.7 million users. 🚀📈 #ProductDevelopment #TeamCollaboration…

item.title: Comparing top PaaS and deployment providers
item.description: Exploring PaaS and deployment providers? This article compares Vercel, Railway, Render, Fly, DigitalOcean App Platform, and Heroku. It highlights their infrastructure, scaling capabilities, pricing models, and developer experiences. For anyone looking to choose the right platform, this comparison offers valuable insights. 🌐💻📊 #PaaS #DeveloperExperience #CloudComputing

item.title: Incident Report: September 22nd, 2025
item.description: 📉 On September 22, 2025, our platform faced an outage that impacted both the dashboard and deployment pipeline. This led to a temporary suspension of deployments for all user tiers. item.title: How We Oops-Proofed Infrastructure Deletion on Railway
item.description: Railway enhances cloud infrastructure safety with a focus on staged changes and undoable deletions. This approach ensures that destructive actions, such as deleting infrastructure, are carefully managed from the dashboard to the underlying physical resources. Learn more about how these methods protect users and improve overall reliability. #CloudInfrastructure #SafetyFirst #TechInnovation 🌐🔧💡
